tool_description: Given a content item, FakeRank returns the probability of that item to be false or misleading.It leverages knowledge from the Web with Deep Learning and Natural Language Processing to understand the meaning of a news story and verify that it is supported by facts.
name: FakeRank
title: FakeRank

api_list.name: classifyProblematicCategory
api_list.description: Returns the identified content category and confidence score in the classification. Return if the content category was identified as problematic

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: URL of the account to check

api_list.name: checkToxicScore
api_list.description: Returns the overall toxicity score and a list of text spans identified as toxic

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: URL of the account to check

api_list.name: checkFailedFact
api_list.description: Returns the identified content category and confidence score in the classification. Return if the content category was identified as problematic

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: URL of the account to check

api_list.name: classifySensitiveCategory
api_list.description: Returns further information about the problematic content or empty if it's not suspect

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: URL of the account to check

api_list.name: checkFakerankScore
api_list.description: The content model considers 10 different signals of Fake News variants including “Pseudo-science”, “Conspiracy”, “Extreme Bias”, “Divisive Language” and more

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: URL of the account to check

schema.description: Returns the predicted score and factual accuracy (closer to 1 means lower factual accuracy).
